title: First Clause in a SQL Query
text: The SELECT clause of a SQL statement that defines what kind of data is being drawn, must always come first.

title: Ordering of WHERE
text: The WHERE clause can never come first in a SQL query.

title: Standard SQL Clause Ordering
text: In SQL, the clauses always follow the order where SELECT always comes first, then the FROM clause, then the WHERE condition comes last. In the SELECT clause, the user specifies the columns of interest from the specified dataset (FROM) and WHERE to aggregate rows based on conditions.
